pages.text: One of the most essential ways of transmitting mechanical power is through gears and axles.$(br2)Linear force from flowing water or wind currents is converted to rotational force by means of free-moving lever arms, which can be seen in waterwheels and windmills.
The $(thing)gearbox$() is a simple mechanism which allows waterwheels and windmills to transfer its energy to a driving axle.$(br2)Input: Axle $(br)Output: Axle
The axle is what allows power to be transferred from the gearbox to a mechanical machine or another gearbox.$(br2)Input: Gearbox$(br)Output: Mechanical machine/gearbox

$(o)Guidelines:$(br2)Gearbox have directional input; make sure its input face is facing the right side.$(br2)Aside from the input face, the rest of the gearbox faces can be used as outputs$(br2)You can rotate a gearbox by shift-right-clicking with an empty hand$(br2)Windmills and waterwheels can be placed on an axle and used to create rotational force for the rest of the network.
